text:
The function org.apache.log4j.helpers.DateLayout.setDateFormat(String 
dateFormat) in performs a toUpperCase on the dateFormat parameter, which may 
cause the format string to be invalid if it is a SimpleDateFormat string (e.g. 
yyyy.MM.dd) and not a predefined string (e.g. "NULL", "DATE", etc.).
creator: vertigino@yahoo.com

text: Yes, indeed. Thank you. Fortunately, this is easy to fix. Ceki
creator: bugzilla@apache.org

text: Has been fixed in 1.1.3. Regards, Ceki
creator: bugzilla@apache.org
